title: StableCoin Wallet without Internet
description:
Problems in Africa

\*.No Internet

\*.Money Losing Value due to Inflation

\*.Week links to Global Financials Systems

\*.Unprocessed Exports

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is request for funding to deliver a proof of concept stablecoin wallet for Africa which can work without an internet connection. THis could be a great product, however the proposal lacks detail just referencing some key technical terms and the Djed stablecoin paper.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal lacks detail on how this would be achieved or that the proposer has the experience to deliver it. There is very little discussion of how the stable coin would work without an internet connection, merely referencing the Djed stable coin paper. The only current implementation of  Djed at the moment is the SigmaUSD coin on ERGO which requires an internet connection to interact with, and is having issues with the protocol being attacked (I have been in discussions with the ERGO team directly on possible solutions to this). Unfortunately a much more detailed plan would need to be provided to have the confidence this could be successfully delivered.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is only asking for funding to develop a prototype, which could be audited. Success however would required more work on whether the solution is actually stable, secure, scalable and robust.
f6_assessments.reply: The main Time stone and all funds will go to create the link between the blockchain and the USSD/STK GSM Gateway, it will be a Smart contract with one function to translate the Transaction Data (sender phone number-receiver phone number-amount in StableCoin Tokin) to (sender wallet address-receiver wallet address-amount in StableCoin Tokin) , my core Idea is to build a link between the GSM Communication Protocol and Cardano BlockChain.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a wonderful proposal and can effectively address the challenge problem if executed well as a Defi app.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal was clearly written well but failed to address a key aspect of blockchain communication with external apps.This is very important for reconciliation of transactions by the smart-contract on the blockchain especially considering that transactions can occur both offline and online.
There seem to be a mismatch between requested funds ($25000) and cost breakdown total ($150000) without a clear explanation of how it is arrived or how it will be sourced.
The proposal request for funds to pay Smart-contract development as regards to first tackling License/Legal first shows a lack of understanding of the implementation process, this is coming from experience as a VAS(Value added service) engineer for 7 years and also managing the second Largest mobile airtime micro-lending service in Nigeria (https://airtel.com.ng/pay_and_recharge/airtime/borrow_airtime), knowing well the importance of Licensing and Legal processes in Mobile network Operations.
The above mentioned can be carefully worked on to make this project a success but at its current form i do not see the proposal being implemented Successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal listed timelines and milestones which are misleading by separating the project phase from the timelines.It will be clearer if timelines and milestones are Clearly outlined together and not independently which makes it difficult to know what milestone is achieved at what time and at what phase of the project.
Proposal lacks a clear breakdown of the requested funds and how it will be utilised and makes me strongly disagree this project can be audited in its current state.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solution does not objectively addresses the problems of the campaign. There is just one application to be developed on the plan and the proposal does not try to explain how it expects to overcome the problems of the poor African economies and what exactly the application will do or how it will be operationally viable. There is no goal regarding the adoption of the target market and there is no reference to potential challenges that will be faced like scalability and interoperability.
f6_assessments.q1: Even though the proposer detains a solid amount of experience, the proposal does not show a lot of details on how it will execute the plan. The budget is not clear or reasonable. The timetable is very broad and the milestones are very hard to be measured. The plan lacks details about what is being done and also how it will be done.
f6_assessments.q2: Because the milestones are very ample, it is hard to track progress and understand how the project is doing. There's no KPIs defined to monitor progress and the roadmap is virtually inexistent.

f6_assessments.q0: There is a great need for this, and as long as the execution of this project goes well: it will address many concerns and will present many advantages for DeFi and Microlending for Africa. This can add stability, and through Cardano, of some of the financial transactions that is problematic in Africa, and I imagine provide a model for other like areas if successful.
f6_assessments.q1: Tareq's experience as a communications engineer and entrepreneur seems to have served well in developing this proposal. There are quite a few technical details in his attached PowerPoint that are useful in evaluating the technical aspects of his proposal. What he may lack in technical skills he seems to seek to supplement the development of the wallet by hiring a consultant--which seems wise. I would be concerned about some of the division of the $25k and that it solely goes to a developer and in terms of providing the wallet without taking into account marketing and other delivery/post-production costs...as well as pre-production and production costs that may go over the need of just the development of the wallet.
f6_assessments.q2:
Most information provided well details the proposal's scope and rollout of the project, however the timeline and milestones could have provided better result metrics to measure success by.
Another concern is how development other than what the $25K covers occurs, and how all of it can be more secure in terms of reading about a known and reputable part time developer since that is where the funds is going.
Other that that: the flowcharts provided, and explanations, seem to me that there can be success here with some addressing of IT development and project management concerns.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge as it would encourage usage at a grassroot level
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has relevant experience thus increasing the success of this project. A detailed budget should be provided highlighting where the funds will be used as well as how the proposal would handle the existence of telco with mobile money wallets such as MTN and Airtel to name but a few.
f6_assessments.q2: Given that the fund would be a multi-fund project, it would be ideal to provide voters with detailed breakdowns and plans as this would improve auditability and the potential success of the project as the success or failure of one part may impact another so this would mitigate risk.

f6_assessments.q0:
Access to internet is so limited in Africa, Saying that from my own experience as an African.
Money depreciation is so common that business owners and population in general face a challenge to make their economic activities sustain.
Having a stable coin that won't be affected by those changes, would help a lot of people. That's why I support this idea presented in this proposal. But am worried about the way the solution is presented with technical words, hard to be understood by whoever doesn't have a programing background. 
It could have been better to describe with some details, the solution proposed.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposed team can undertake this project, but the team may be missing some key people for marketing and promotion. The timeframe doesn't seem to be concise with details on various activities that will take place.
The budget is confusing with some numbers that are not included in the requested budget, but apprear on the budget section. Better was then to have 2 part in the budget section: Total budget (Catalyst F6 request funds + funds from other sources) & partial budget that will include only the requested funds.
The requested funds are not detailed on how they'll be used. 
The proposal is feasible but some keys elements are missing to make it clear to any reader.
f6_assessments.q2: No raised, the audit process not presented. The proposal intents to address a very important issue, but some important elements are not presented in order to evaluate the outcome
